alert.note: Alert for Cayuga; Cortland; Schuyler; Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 10:01AM EST until February 19 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Schuyler County in central New York... Southeastern Cayuga County in central New York... Cortland County in central New York... Tompkins County in central New York... * Until 1045 AM EST. * At 1001 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Scott to Montour Falls, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Ithaca, Cortland, Newfield, Cayuga Heights, Lansing, Enfield, Homer, Virgil, Groton and Locke. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 9 and 12. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
